title: Badge & Borrow
description: A social engineering theft of hardware keys threatens to compromise the entire system.

scenes.narrative: You've tracked the suspect to a corporate office building. Security is tight, but your informant suggests the target is using social engineering tactics to gain access to restricted areas.

choices.label: Pose as IT support to gain entry and observe.
choices.consequence: You blend in seamlessly with the staff, overhearing conversations about the key theft.

choices.label: Analyze security patterns from external surveillance.
choices.consequence: You identify a vulnerability in the badge system that could be exploited.

choices.label: Deploy a micro-drone to scout the interior.
choices.consequence: The drone captures footage of the suspect using a borrowed badge.

choices.label: This feels staged - abort and watch from afar.
choices.consequence: You pull back just as security responds to an alarm, avoiding detection.

scenes.narrative: Inside the building, you confront the suspect who claims to be a legitimate contractor. The hardware keys are missing from the secure vault.

choices.label: Question the suspect diplomatically to gather information.
choices.consequence: The suspect reveals details about the social engineering method used.

choices.label: Check security logs for the breach timeline.
choices.consequence: Logs show the keys were accessed during a maintenance window.

choices.label: Use a portable scanner to trace the keys' signal.
choices.consequence: The scanner detects the keys are still in the building but moving.

choices.label: The setup is too perfect - this is a distraction.
choices.consequence: You ignore the suspect and focus on the real threat, finding the keys hidden elsewhere.
